website_summaries.verdict: The rugged Nikon Coolpix AW100 is a fine choice for shallow water or dry land adventures -- just make sure you have plenty of light.
pros: The Nikon Coolpix AW100 has good rugged specifications for its price and solid GPS performance
The camera is also fairly easy to use out of the box
cons: The AW100's slow lens requires more use of high ISO settings or slow shutter speeds
Its controls feel spongy and occasionally unresponsive due to the waterproofing and the body's somewhat slippery

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with the camera
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with the camera, landscapes with good light are simply amazing, and the sound is pretty good too. GPS option is not synchronized with google maps or another GPS online provider, so you need to open the map on your laptop and see the locations, not so practical nowadays. A short time after I made the purchase, a wi-fi version was released, bad luck for me since currently this is a completely necessary feature. Robust as hell for outdoor use, specially hiking, camping and adventure sports.
customer_reviews.author: Judamo

customer_reviews.title: Reliable with great features.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this model for several years now. It's been terrific and water proof. I like that I don't need to worry about - drag it everywhere I go. Zoom is amazing. Gps is nice. Great looking pictures. Only downside is indoor photos. The flash is either too powerful or blurred pictures. Not all the time but enough to be a PITa. My brother bought the subsequent version. Same model. He loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment. TWO broke.
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a huge disappointment. I've actually bought this camera twice and both times it broke. I used one extensively for a year and had no problems. I took it in the ocean, hot weather, cold weather, dropped it... Everything was find until I had it exactly one year then one second it worked and the next it didnt. Although the camera turned on, the screen was completely black. Because it takes good pictures and I had all the accessories, I purchased a second thinking I couldnt have the same problem twice. I took the second camera in the water once and the screen went black just like the first.
customer_reviews.author: Annie M

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera, Lousy Proprietary Battery
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about a year and a half ago. Has some great features, takes nices pictures, looks good, sturdy design, decent accessories offered. The battery however died on me after only charging to capacity a few times. Have contacted Nikon about it, not yet received any word back. Will update review if/when I do. Overall a very good point and shoot camera that is built to survive drops spills and submersion. Would reccommend getting a lense cover and extended warranty though. Its a bit expensive, but still nice. Worthiness of price TBD by service offered, by features though would says Yes.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Better than disposable
customer_reviews.text: The maiden voyage was a dirty dune buggy trip. It got dirty and just washed off. It was very waterproof. The land pictures are fair. The underwater pictures are good. We went down to 20 feet. The main justification is that those disposable cameras take mostly unusable pictures, are unpredictable as to where you can buy them, cost a lot between taking (and yes.. developing) and oh yeah, two trips to "develop pictures. How did we do it? . If you are someone that likes to chronicle life, thus needs to take the underwater and gritting pix, then go for it. But keep your land camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera with lots of Extras
customer_reviews.text: I was hopping that this camera would be the ticket between a bulky SLR and a point and shoot. During a vacation with three teenagers throuigh Disney the camera worked perfectly to capture great shots. Easy to use and good pictures and you can make lots of adjustments or use the pre set adjustments. Flash works well. You can shoot fill flash too. The only minus was that the screen became scratched in my pocket, something in these days of high strength glass for phones you wouild thing something that strong would be on this cool camera. But, it isn't bad and I'll be happy to have the camera with or without the scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Lousy Pics
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2013. Partner's iPhone takes far superior photos. Only advantage of the Nikon is the zoom. Unlike the phone, this device has ONE JOB - and it can't even compete. What excuse is there for that ? Especially for the money, it's ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: corazon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon COOLPIX AW100 was a fallback position when my research into underwater camera housings for my Nikon D200 found prices at 3x what I paid for the camera body alone. I didn't want another camera, although the idea of a point-and-shoot other than my smartphone did appeal to me. This camera did not disappoint. It has many of the same features as my D200 at double the resolution. Besides waterproof, it's shockproof, freezeproof, and sandproof - something I can't say about the D200. I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone no matter what they need a camera to do.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Lundgren

customer_reviews.title: Takes Abuse & Records Well
customer_reviews.text: I have already fell onto asphalt with camera face down. Shell abused but lens not scratched and still works as designed. Remains water tight (not used underwater yet). Has withstood heat, humidity, spaahes while canoeing an kayaking. Image stabilization works well even under zoom. Graet to alternate slides and video. Keep in mind that this is not a SLR camera with great lenses. However also remember that the best camera is the one you take with you and this one is easy to take and the resolution is wonderful within its catagory. Only drawback is battery time not exceptional. Keep extra battery on hand just in case, especially if you use GPS function.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera. We love taking it in the pool ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera. We love taking it in the pool or the lake and getting the shots that nobody else is getting. I work in wilderness areas and always take this camera with me. It has endured the extremely hot southern Arizona sun and some rough treatment against rocks and other equipment. I also love the GPS feature and being able to look through the pictures and see where they were taken. I have also used this to take underwater pictures of aquatic insects and they turned out truly awesome giving a perspective that you just can't get any other way. If this one ever dies I will quickly get another.
customer_reviews.author: buffalobeal

customer_reviews.title: Untested yet
customer_reviews.text: It arrived and all was as stated. Charged the battery, took some pics, and so far so good. I haven't had a chance to test it underwater yet but hope to this week end. If it performs the same underwater, I will love it!! It's a good, small, manageable size. 7/29 - Update: Took the camera with us to Destin and used it underwater. It performed GREAT!! We never reached the depth limit of 35'. as we were just over 25'. NO problems and the picture quality is better than I expected. All around I have to give it a 5 star rating!! Worked as advertised - no problems with battery life what so ever. I definitely recommend this camera!!
customer_reviews.author: NannyInTexas

customer_reviews.title: Worst underwater camera - takes on water
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a Nikon fan (been dabbling in photography for 35 years) and have always owned a Nikon. So, when considering an underwater camera, trusting Nikon quality was a given. I've had two of these so far - I had to get the first one replaced because it was fogging up (condensation within the camera), and Nikon sent me a replacement. The first time I took the replacement camera underwater, it took in full water. And I'm only talking a couple of feet deep. Ruined all of my vacation pictures of Aruba. Do yourself a favor. Buy the Fujifilm Finepix underwater camera. It's much cheaper, and I've had absolutely no problems with it. It takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: GumboMambo

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Takes awesome pics. Left it overnight in the snow, it got stepped on and still worked. It has been dropped in water, splashed with water and on a very sandy beach. The camera is incredibly tough. Takes great stills and action shots. I don't mountain climb or do any kind of extreme outdoor activity, I got this camera to stand up to my 14 month old, hyperactive 8 year old and their mom who is a serial dropper/spiller who takes too many pictures. Trust me when I say this camera has been through a ridiculous amount of abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny T.

customer_reviews.title: Best underwater, adventure camera ever.
customer_reviews.text: Took this camera on my honeymoon cruise. Worked perfectly and never had an issue with the built in programming. I took this camera snorkeling and all the other divers were jealous! Took fantastic underwater video with sound and colorful life like photos underwater. Alot of the others had underwater cameras but some did not hold up as promised or didn't get the quality we did. This was perfect. We even banged it a few times during our ATV adventure and didn't run in to any problems. Product held up well and was a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ribroast

customer_reviews.title: Great little Camera
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought this before our honeymoon. Our other submersible camera had died during a vacation and there was no way we were going snorkeling without a camera like this. We read a lot of reviews and decided that Nikon was probably the best bet. I'm of the opinion that a still camera should be a still camera and a video camera should be a video camera, so I wasn't really expecting decent quality out of this when it came to video. Turns out it does a pretty decent job. We are very satisfied with this and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beach
customer_reviews.text: I live on a barrier island in Florida so I spend a lot of time in and near the water. I like the peace of mind I get that the camera is water proof. This camera is small and light. I carry it in my cargo shorts or in my bathing suit. Either way, I sometimes forget I'm carrying it. The photo quality is great and the camera feels sturdy in my hand. The menu system is easy to use and the dedicated buttons eliminate the need to burrow thru a menu to perform common tasks like switching between shooting and viewing. I'm also finding the battery life suits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for water fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because we were going to the Bahamas and I wanted an underwater camera. I've been very happy with EVERY Nikon Coolpix camera I have already purchased (S570, S6200), so I thought that sticking with a camera I know and trust would be the best bet for me. It is very easy to use and I am extremely pleased with the pictures and video that I took. I've been looking at this camera for over a year and finally got it before our Bahamas trip. It's just a good fit for me and everyone is amazed at the pictures I take with all my Coolpix cameras. This one is perfect for water shots and fun water video!
customer_reviews.author: Packer Girl 32

customer_reviews.title: Great value and easy to use.  A must for knockabout use at beach or ocean....anywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Had nothing but success with this camera. Have an extra battery and use this camera for all my photos. Takes very respectable HD video too. Immersed this thing dozens of times in salt water never a problem with water intrusion or moisture. Just used common sense when opening door to replace battery or download the pictures. Would buy one of these again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia C

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a dive in the South China Sea. I like this camera a lot. It takes great photos and video. The large screen is great for underwater photos. I like that it saves lots of information about the photos, including aperture, exposure time etc, including longitude and latitude if GPS function is turned on. It was not as fast taking repeat photos sometime as I would have liked. I wish it could have had more actual zoom than 4x but understand the limitation due to internal lens zooming. Other than that great camera would recommend and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Buc

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, but not happy with Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The camera itself is fine, except for the problem with the condensation on the display that others have noticed. I would not use this camera for extended underwater use for that reason. The thing that really ticks me off is this was one of the "deals" that Amazon emailed me. I ordered it without checking further (my bad), only to found out that I could buy the next model HIGHER (with Wireless connectivity) for about $50 LESS through Amazon. From now on I'll realize that when Amazon tells me they have a deal for me, they really mean they're trying to unload a less than current model.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis G.

customer_reviews.title: If you're a klutz this is the camera for you!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera about 3 years ago, since then I have tossed it down a mountain, left it in freezing temperatures and had it fall in a river. Despite my clumsiness this camera is still in absolutely wonderful working condition. The underwater photos are great, the white water rafting videos are awesome and the regular photos are great compared to other durable outdoor cameras. If you're looking for a camera that can handle the roughest of users this might be your winner. I'm considering getting the AW120 just for the wide lens and the wi-fi but honestly I'm still so happy with this one that I can't bring myself to.
customer_reviews.author: L. Savary09

customer_reviews.title: nice camera, but one down side
customer_reviews.text: I love this little camera--great photo quality, very easy to slip in a pocket and go. It took very nice pics--both on land and worked well in the water (playing in the surf, snorkeling, nothing too deep). The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is there seems to be a problem with water leaking between the layers of the lcd display. It doesn't affect the lens or pictures, but does show up as bubbles or fog on the viewer. Amazon replaced the first one (it happened within a month of purchase), but the second one also seems to have a similar problem. But it's still a great camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: L. Day

customer_reviews.title: best camera on market
customer_reviews.text: i like nikon because they consistently make high-value products at a mild cost. this camera is no exception. it has GPS, up to 16 megapixels, macro, imaging options, and memory the size of the SD card that you put in it. i saw it advertised in National Geographic as a rugged camera. living up to its reputation, this camera has endured falls and scratches. while i haven't tested its advertised water resistance, i will assume that this quality is part of the reasonable priced best camera in the price bracket.
customer_reviews.author: soundwaveclick

customer_reviews.title: I love it but..
customer_reviews.text: this camera has exceeded all my expectations, I was a full SONY CYBERSHOT user, but since I bougth this camera, I would never change NIKON!! I only have 2 unresolved issues with it, one othem is the GPS.. I live in Honduras and I just can't make it work, maybe when I travel to usa or some other country it works. and the other one is the shaking feature, it works when I don't want it to work and it doesn't when I need it to work. i've read the manual and im not that fan of shaking.. but in general, all the features, video, settings, OMG its just great!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Rodriguez Pagoaga

customer_reviews.title: Lens condensation blurs photos
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this camera 9/1/2012 because I wanted a camera to take with me while boating. It takes nice pictures at first, but after getting splashed a few times it gets condensation on the lens that will either leave images foggy, or leave them with fog spots. It is frustrating as there is no water getting into the camera. Perhaps it is the change of temperature from cold water and warm weather, but after seeing other reviews it seems like others experience the same issue without splashing the camera.
customer_reviews.author: R. Waddell

customer_reviews.title: Fun little camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. Pro tip: use some Rain-X or something on the outside lens if you’re shooting above water, but still getting wet. Otherwise water covers your pics, and that’s no good. (not a problem underwater, of course) I think my iPhone takes slightly better photos/videos, but it’s nice to not worry about ruining my phone. Also, the battery on this thing lasts quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Que

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great "life-proof" camera. Have used it in the pool, lake and ocean. dropped it banged it up. does not dent or scratch easily. Takes outstanding pictures. Very easy interface and simplistic menus. If you are looking for a camera that has "beauty fix" and other add ins to make your pictures pretty, this is not your camera. If you are looking for a no shit camera that can take some punishment and provide beautiful pictures, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: stephen sikorski

customer_reviews.title: It work like a professional camera
customer_reviews.text: Its a phenomenal camera.It work like a professional camera. love the sharpness of the pictures even if the object is moving. Would definitely recommend this camera to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value for price - a Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Nikon coolpix aw100 on a whim to take with us on our trip to Oahu Hawaii. It is our first day back home and I'm astounded at what we captured using this little camera. It's ridiculously easy to use, the settings are intuitive and the video is fabulous too! Here is a quick list of why we loved this camera: 1. Waterproof, Shock Proof 2. Ease of Use 3. Quality of photos and videos 4. Price Point You will not be disappointed! I'll add some photos of our trip, so keep your eyes open.
customer_reviews.author: Tonsies

customer_reviews.title: Wow! what a price change!
customer_reviews.text: The five star is based on a little bit of use just prior to my daughter leaving with it to Costa Rica for two weeks. It was easy to set up and to use, pictures looked great. My son will take it for two months to Viet Nam and China this summer (if daughter hasn't lost it). I guess we got a great deal, because I paid $170 for it from Amazon. Am really looking forward to seeing the pictures and videos she will have taken, and will post our feedback more completely at that time. Hope the floaty strap works for when she inevitably drops it off a reef. . .
customer_reviews.author: looking for great reads

customer_reviews.title: Good Times Captured
customer_reviews.text: This camera is exactly what i expected. It takes very quality shots, I have not had any come out fuzzy. Those who are having problems must be missing something. I have yet to use the underwater functions, but i have a vacation coming up and will update then. The only reason i rate 4 stars instead of 5, is the shake function on the camera. I really wish there was a way to turn this off. It gets very annoying when looking through pictures, if you turn the camera to show another person the picture, it thinks you are shaking it and changes to another picture.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W

customer_reviews.title: Love the underwater camera!
customer_reviews.text: We took it for a three week trip in Central America. It was so much fun to use scuba diving, kayaking, swimming, etc. I highly recommend this product! One note: the battery was going dead pretty fast, so I shut off the gps system. I think that it kept searching for my location and it was draining the battery. Other than that - it was great! Took it down to about 30 feet when scuba diving.
customer_reviews.author: philephan81

customer_reviews.title: Tkaes good pictures but reliability is terrible and its way overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: The camera takes great pics and the battery life is good but the screen stopped working after 5 uses and now I take pictured blind. I can dowload them to my laptop and see them but when I use the camera under water or on ground the screen vever works cant see the menus cant review the pics. Since its about 2 years old and out of warranty I will not spend the money to fix it. Its just bad bad reliability that after 5 uses and 1.5 years the screen died.
customer_reviews.author: Izak K.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FOR ANY UNDERWATER PHOTOGRAPHY
customer_reviews.text: Product failed first time I submerged it in the water. Worked for a while then shut off. Then lens fogged over completely and LED screen stopped working. The camera worked great for any other non underwater photography. It simply just isn't waterproof. Why Nikon advertises this as being waterproof and shockproof is beyond me. Water resistant maybe but if you submerge it then it will fail eventually. Read the other 80 reviews on amazon if you don't believe me. I AM PISSED.
customer_reviews.author: CSP

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this camera as a gift for our son who was serving in Kuwait. He wanted a camera that could withstand harsh conditions, including sand storms. This camera has fit the bill. My husband and I even took it to Hawaii to use while snorkeling since it is waterproof. We had no problems with the camera and it took great underwater pictures. I did get the warranty because of some of the reviews, but have never had to use it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kittel

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a year. Now very slow write speed
customer_reviews.text: This camera worked great for a year, and it indeed took underwater HD movies. The macro function is very good, better than my Canon DSLR. Now, after the warranty expired(!) the image write speed is v-e-r-y slow, like up to 30 seconds until I can take another photo. Also, I don't think it's recording movies. We've never dropped it, and even if we did, it's supposed to be shock proof as well. We've even tried a different SD card to no avail. I guess I should have stuck with Canon...
customer_reviews.author: dcdude

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Been in pools with it, rain, dirt. Gave it 4 stars because the GPS feature is a little spotty. It doesn't always mark your location correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera I've had it for years! Great picture quality both in and out of water.
customer_reviews.author: Afulks

customer_reviews.title: good for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera over a year ago. For a point and shoot it does its job. It handles cold better than my last camera. I have not tested the waterproof function yet but it has handled rain, snow and sweat well. It does not handle low light or fast shots as well as I would like but it has served its purpose well. For a back up camera or one that you are taking places you don't want to take a more expensive camera, I recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Alizon Roth

customer_reviews.title: Great all purpose camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera vs the Panasonic because i saw how well it performed under water. A friend had one in Mexico where i was snorkeling and show me pics from underwater and it came out like any other clear daytime pics. Now i'm headed back to Cancun and will be taking one myself. Review Addendum: This camera takes phenomenal pictures in/out of water. Numerous pic settings provide all types of picture quality. Panoramic assist is an absolute great feature. Vids are great with high quality recordings. See Pic.
customer_reviews.author: Master Woo

customer_reviews.title: Lens fogs up from the inside
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera, when the lens is not fogged-up. It fogs up from the inside which means somehow water got inside. I used it one time for about 5 gentle minutes in the water. All other uses have been on land in regular conditions. I haven't even begun to use it in the rugged way it advertises. I've been very careful with the seal door, followed all the rules, haven't let anything get caught in the door, nothing that would break the seal. So it's defective. I wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Mother Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: takes very good land and underwater pictures as well as video
customer_reviews.text: takes very good land and underwater pictures as well as video. However, as noted in other reviews the camera did shut down twice in the first week I owned it while taking pictures in the ocean. both times was less than 20 feet of water and condensation was evident in the body of the camera. I opened it up and let it sit in the sun, on 90 degree days in a bag of rice, and it resumed working. Haven't had a chance to test since
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Nikon Coolpix. Don't get me wrong it has nothing to do with the camera being defective, I still have mine and use it all the time. The other two were gifts for my sister and dad. I guess you can say we are a Nikon family everyone love their respective model and still has/uses them. Even my dad who is really bad with technical things had no problem using this camera and transferring photos to his PC. In addition, the software the camera uses is really easy to install and use.
customer_reviews.author: Bolow

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: I have had a chance to shoot several hundred pictures and videos through this camera. Most of the pictures taken have been crystal clear and excellent color. I was absolutely amazed at the quality of the video this is able to shoot as well. The video is amazingly sharp, although the audio is not very tightly focused on where the video is being shot. The only pictures I have had trouble with are inside pics with no flash - I haven't always been happy with the color reproduction. I have not had a chance to try to waterproof feature yet, although I am looking forward to it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Basballe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, great underwater pictures and video.... 5 stars all the way!
customer_reviews.author: G.

customer_reviews.title: Great All-Weather Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great all-weather camera that you don't ever have to be worried about getting wet. We have used it at the beach in the waves and under water at the pool. Takes great pictures and videos as you would expect from a Nikon. Also purchased a floating strap so you don't have to worry about dropping in the water either. GPS works - gets your location in the right place - but if you're looking for a usable GPS device this is not it. Not a deal breaker but worth mentioning...
customer_reviews.author: MikeS

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fantastic, rugged and takes beautiful pictures and videos. I bought it with the olympus strap float and just hooked the float around my arm when going snorkelling. My one complaint is that after one use, the front cover appears to not be intact and slightly coming away from the camera and I had to press it down to get it back on there. However, this did not appear to affect the camera's ability to take pictures and there was no fogging up afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Neola Z.

customer_reviews.title: Backpacker's dream
customer_reviews.text: I used to hump my favorite camera from another company, full size digital and that was a bear, not to mention I was always scared it was going over the mountain or into the stream. This baby takes EXCELLENT quality photos, is lite and much more portable. The GPS feature is particularly awesome when overlaying maps, I always write down compass direction to really orient people when showing off the photos. I don't worry when it rains, and the strap stays around my neck when in precarious positions, so no dropping worries.
customer_reviews.author: William Cardinal

customer_reviews.title: Survived Hawaii!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just before a trip to Hawaii because I didn't want to take my Nikon D60 into the ocean (makes sense, right?). This camera took great pictures in and out of the water. I carried it everywhere because of its size and the fact that it tended to randomly rain there and I still wanted to take pictures. The battery lasts a very reasonable amount of time. Only had to charge it a few times while on vacation (I was hoping I wouldn't regret not getting an extra battery)!
customer_reviews.author: M. Artmann

customer_reviews.title: Grand Canyon Raft Trip Approved...
customer_reviews.text: This camera stayed tucked into my PFD, attached to its Croakie float strap, buckled to my PFD. I could take pics quickly this way. Thanks to the fast start-up time and the waterproofing I documented most of the Grand Canyon from my raft when I wasn't paddling or holding on with both hands. 3 batteries were good for 6 days on the Colorado River. Class 5 rapid tested... class 5 rapid smiles documented. Excellent camera. 625 pics, 5 min of video from that inaugural trip and I don't plan on leaving it behind on any future trip.
customer_reviews.author: simplyfoote

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera - Battery life could have been better.
customer_reviews.text: We really like this camera. Kids are having a blast with it in the pool and water parks. So far we've used this camera under water at least 6 times. No issues with water leaking or anything. Kids dropped it couple of times too. But the camera handled it pretty well. I wish the battery life was better on this camera though. You definitely need a spare battery. Also the lens should have had some kind of coating to keep the water off.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my sister. She loves it. Great quality pictures and reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Varela

customer_reviews.title: Best rugged camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who is an avid fisherman. I'm jealous. I totally want one now. Great quality pictures! They blow up to 8x10 with great quality. Shoots well in all conditions. Don't know how much he has used the underwater mode because he usually shoots underwater video and stills with our Kodak playsport cameras but this takes much better quality stills than that camera. Bought myself another camera a few years ago that I never use because this camera has much better quality pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Waterproof camera!
customer_reviews.text: Nice size and easy controls access. Really clear pictures land or sea. I ordered a Nikon brand rubber case which is fantastic with this camera. A++
customer_reviews.author: Dads66

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this camera for almost three years now, and it has held up to its end of the bargain (and still going strong). It has been scuba diving in multiple locations (all salt water dives) to a maximum of 30 feet with no leaking, no corrosion, no issues period. The photos it takes both in and out of the water are not perfect but definitely great for an underwater camera. The only complaint I have would be it's ability to focus properly in low lighting. The auto adjust definitely needs some improvement, so I have learned to take multiple shots when photographing at night.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service by Nikon - Excellent Service by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Camera takes excellent pictures, but the charger for the battery failed after less than 2 charges and as per Nikon customer service it is not under warranty!!!!!!!! But they would gladly sell me a new one... what nuisance. I guess I will return the camera and charger to Amazon and ask for a replacement unit. Update: outside of the 30 day return period ;-( - contacted Amazon customer service and they gave me a cash back discount allowing me to purchase a replacement unit.... Way to go AMAZON !!!!!!!!! you have gained a customer for life. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: berlindude

customer_reviews.title: Solid camera, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Solid feel to the camera, well constructed, no rattles or loose parts internally not externally. Quick start up no lag, can snap a photo instantly on start up and subsequently after a photo. No lag on shutdown. Waterproof, shockproof and GPS with a world base map and some landmarks is pretty awesome. Next needs wifi. Price is coming down on this camera which is good because it is our work camera and we tend to lose them or get one stolen every 6 months or so which is better that other cameras we've had at work which tend to be paperweights within a year of on the job service.
customer_reviews.author: A. Roseto

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures
customer_reviews.text: this camera takes great pictures, whether on land or underwater. I used it on a trip to the Bahamas and dove about 30 feet down to take some pictures of sea turtles, coral, fish, etc. all of the pictures came out great and clear. I continue to use this as our main "event" camera. Also, no leaks, no problems with the seal. I have rinsed it after using in water and it is still like new after filling up several 16gb SD cards.
customer_reviews.author: Dsgnce

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for the beach.
customer_reviews.text: I live 50 yards from the beach. I have used this camera daily for over 7 months. My only complaint is the short battery life. Here is a short video showing how well the camera does in bright sunlight. Overcast days aren't nearly as crisp, and you get more noise and artifacts in the video.
customer_reviews.author: Big Fudge

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a great purchase. I wanted one for biking trips so I didn't have to worry about keeping it dry in bad weather and it does that and more. The picture resolution is wonderful. I have even won a local photo contest with the pics I have taken with it. Have not tried it underwater, but kayaking it rocks. Have not really figured out the GPS, but didn't buy it for that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Divegirl

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new camera. Takes good pictures. Easy to use point and shoot. Of course small cameras aren't the best for low light but this one does ok. Good flash. Interface is a little weird but up to now (still am) have been a Canon guy. The Canon waterproof shock proof camera was a little bulky so couldn't buy it. The Panasonic one seemed to routinely get good reviews over the Nikon but couldn't bring myself to give my business to Panasonic after they hosed me on my Superzoom that failed after 1 yr. Word of advice, make sure you buy the right SDHC card for the camera. Nikon only approves 4 makers: Sandisk, Toshiba, panasonic, and Lexar.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not perfect camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent camera with some flaws. The photos are comparable to other point and shoot cameras, but not as nice as those taken with an SLR. Also the GPS function needs to be turned on and is t enabled by default (which is a major feature). We traveled abroad for almost a year before I realized that the GPS wasn't enabled. It is decent when it comes to water. We dropped it in about 30ft working on the boat and recovered it fine.
customer_reviews.author: E. Engel

customer_reviews.title: Water proof, freeze proof, shockproof but not scratch proof
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera about 2 years ago, I loved it and still love it, I take it to every vacation trip I do that I know there will be water involved. I have scuba dived with it 35 to 40 ft and works perfectly. I accidentally dropped it from 2 feet into rocks. It just scratched a little bit the metal paint but, it still works really well and battery will last a full day of use.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Campos

customer_reviews.title: It's ok I guess
customer_reviews.text: I used this camara several times in water without incident, and it took wonderful pictures in and out of water. I give it to my friend to use in the jacuzzi and it sucked in water somehow and became unusable. Since I wasn't the one operating it, it may have been operater error. I found that if you are not sure how to properly operate the camara, you could easily and mistakenly open it while in use in water.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: This camera is supposedly waterproof but every time I dive in I see water inside the battery/memory compartment. The water also ruined the LCD , I could see it was all misty Nikon replaced the camera and after a few months I had the same inconveniences, I complained again and Nikon said the warranty had expired. In conclusion I had a camera that I could barely use The Nikon service is really bad
customer_reviews.author: Gabe S

customer_reviews.title: Takes decent photos
customer_reviews.text: This camera wont win any awards with the photos it takes, but it does the job if you need a rugged camera. The buttons on the back feel flimsy and there are not manual settings for taking photos. Overall it is an average point and shoot that is unique because it can handle abuse, water, and dirt. I use this camera to take photos at ARMY training events. GPS works well, but is confusing to navigate. Also, GPS drains the battery very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: This camera rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I did my homework before buying this camera. We love Nikon at our house - we own many. I needed a sturdy waterproof camera for my daughter and this one fits the bill nicely. Enough megapixels to please the geek in me, but still easy for her to use and upload photos to her computer. Love the large viewscreen, and because we are Nikon gals, so easy for both of us to use. Came in orange or blue but we like the black one. This camera will get a lot of use at our house.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Cox

customer_reviews.title: No warranty from Nikon
customer_reviews.text: Water got into the camera after snorkeling less than an hour, so I sent it to Nikon service at US for warranty and they returned it after 5 or 6 months exactly as it was!!! (damaged) And I had to pay for the shipping cost, and Nikon did even check the camera that was the objetive. Very bad service from Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Well, it's waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this camera. I thought for this much money that it would take better pictures than it did. My cellphone takes better pictures! The range on the lens is not very much, and the viewfinder is difficult to see through. But I did try it underwater and it was waterproof! I was in the ocean and nothing came out except mirky pictures, but I am going to try it in a pool to see if I actually get a picture.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly S

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for a about 5years and i have done it all with this camera. Way ahead of its time. It really does exactly what it says it does, and then some. Hats off to you nikon...
customer_reviews.author: Cindygpr

customer_reviews.title: Pretty spendy
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could say that this camera is worth every penny, but the fact is that while it is waterproof and shockproof the actual pix and videos are seldom crisp and clear. Underwater pictures usually need to be in telephoto which drains the battery incredibly. I had one experience where it wouldn't turn off until I opened it up and removed the battery. This is just not something one likes to do when snorkeling in the Pacific!
customer_reviews.author: Tezinnv

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great warranty
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. Pictures are sharp and clear with flawless color. Easy to use and very versatile. Took a great picture of a sea turtle underwater in Hawaii while skin diving. Shortly after the camera flooded and was returned to Nikon. Nikon is honoring the warranty and repairing the camera free of charge. This is very different from Casio which attributed every warranty claim to customer abuse and denies the claim. Great camera, should be good to 30 feet underwater. Think I'll keep it above 10 feet in the future.
customer_reviews.author: TedT

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: We took this camera to Hawaii and it was worth every penny. The pics were great, the clarity was wonderful, and it was easy to use. Warning: buy the writst float because the camera will sink! My husband gave me a hard time for buying a float since he said a waterproof camera should float but we tested it in shallow water at the beach and she sank like a stone! Thank goodness SOMEONE thought to buy a wrist float... :)
customer_reviews.author: Meow

customer_reviews.title: Purchased the Nikon AW100 for my trip to Cabo, Mexico.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Nikon AW100 for my recent trip to Cabo, Mexico. I was so impressed by the quality and toughness of this camera so far. I took it in the salty ocean, in the pools, used as a regular point and shoot, taking pictures of landscapes while our driver is going well over the speed limit. And all the pictures and videos turned out awesome. It's funny to think that I washed my camera in the sink after every underwater or sandy use.
customer_reviews.author: Twins Twice

customer_reviews.title: Cool Camera
customer_reviews.text: I own a Nikonos camera but wanted something smaller and easier to use. This fits the bill. It is easy to use and has the Nikon quality as well. I've tried it in a variety of environments without any issues. The panorama feature is cool but it's tough to find a place to get 4" X 10" prints. The underwater feature is a snap to use and it produces great pictures. A must have for any serious photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W. Borden

customer_reviews.title: Quality camera.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter when she worked in Hawaii last summer. The instructions indicate that one should keep the seal clean and even replace it after about a year of use. It must be a fairly robust little device because my daughter did not manage to ruin it during the course of the summer, even with going to the beach several dozen times! It even takes excellent photographs! I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Doug c

customer_reviews.title: Tuff camera
customer_reviews.text: Tuff little camera I take it hunting with me and keep it in my truck to check my game cameras
customer_reviews.author: cody

customer_reviews.title: Works great for underwater photos!
customer_reviews.text: This camera works well for underwater photos during vacation, which is why I bought it. The down side of the camp style is it does blend in, but we tied a bright color to the strap and that problem was solved. Sometimes pictures look a tad blurry since the autofocus sometimes takes a little longer than others. Overall I would recommend this camera if you need an underwater camera. Best one I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Musican09

customer_reviews.title: Leakage problem
customer_reviews.text: Had this camera for a little over 2 months. We used the camera on our vacation and didn't have a problem with leakage. However, the quality of the pictures was worst than my Pentax WP (when its not being used underwater). The detail of the pictures just wasn't very good for 16mp camera even when compare to the old 5mp Pentax. A couple of month after purchase, the camera started taking in water. Didn't see any physical problems with the seal, so I don't know whats going on except that water is getting into the battery/memory compartment. Now I need to see if I can get it repaired under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: djee

customer_reviews.title: Takes very good videos. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Takes very good videos. Easy to use. Almost 5 years using it and still no problems. It's my camera that I carry with me every day.
customer_reviews.author: Arrietta Benelli

customer_reviews.title: Cool active camera
customer_reviews.text: Took this camera to Italy for a year. LOVE that its waterproof, shock proof, and durable...came in handy. But the display isn't scratch proof. Photo quality is good, but not spectacular and not much room to manipulate settings, but there are A LOT of settings. I really like this camera for its physical capacity, but not anything out of the ordinary in quality of photos.
customer_reviews.author: golSquared

customer_reviews.title: Vacation Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera. I took it and a larger one with me on a family vacation...after seeing the quality of the pictures was about the same and without having to worry about sand and water, I preferentially used this one. It's light-weight, takes excellent pictures, and performed admirably while we were bobbing in the ocean. You also don't have to think too much if you're trying to capture memories (as opposed to composing great works of art).
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes nice pictures. You really need to get up close to the fish to get the best picture - so that is pretty tricky. The zoom doesn't provide the best clarity out of the water, but in the water, helps to get better pictures of the fish. I think it would help if there was some light produced by it to get nicer pictures under water. Still lots of fun to use this camera. Have some really fun vacation pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany deRamos

customer_reviews.title: GZ
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this camera!!!! It is not designed for continuous water submersion as the seal design is just a very thin rubber pad to protect your battery, memory stick, and internal parts of the camera. The seal loses some elasticity over time and the hinge and locking mechanism design are not durable for longer term active use in water. My camera picked up moisture, then water, and failed within 11 months. I am very disappointed with this product, especially based on the price.
customer_reviews.author: zabi

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for snorkeling!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for my trip to Maui. It works well with snorkeling-- I did not dare to bring it with my to my scuba diving trips for fear that the depth may exceed its pressure limit. The pictures came out beautifully. Compared with its performance underwater, this camera does not impress me during my hiking trip as it twists the figures at the corner of the picture (I guess it could be because of the lens deficiency). But overall, this camera served its purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie S.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a birthday gift a while back. It's still running strong and just as durable. I've taken this in the ocean, water parks and swimming pools. It's a great product that takes great pictures and video. Just remember, it's a point and shoot camera and not a DSLR. It can only do so much, but it shines in its category.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: best reviewed
customer_reviews.text: haven't used extensively yet but all reviews were excellent & Nikon makes some of the best digital imaging products available. need rugged, compact, versatile device for traveling & this fits all the required criteria + HD 1080p video, easy media export, GPS (although GPS isn't stellar so far but ill need to experiment further), & zoom. bought the insurance through Amazon's recommended provider which in the past has proven a good choice if issues arise. will test abroad on vacation more thoroughly later this year but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt J Bulicek

customer_reviews.title: Best investment ive made!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best camera ive ever owned. I fully expcect it to be my last. It takes pics that are as good as being there. the panoramic feature is great. the gps works great but can kill the battery quickly. I recommend turning it off unless you plan on taking a pic you want to gps pin. the hd video is clear and the sound crisp. the shock proof and waterproof make it a great outdoorsman camera.
customer_reviews.author: Scott a

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Glad that I got this one. I have quite a few cameras in my days... But this one is bigger than I though, and the photos are just great. It's no power zoom. But I'd have to say it is great for the fact that this camera is water proof, drop resistant, and freeze resistant. Good choice here. This is a rugged camera. Not a model and family portrait camera. There is a difference. Enjoying my new toy!
customer_reviews.author: Kate O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Has great feuture that no one points
customer_reviews.text: Just received this camera. Tested out, great, however I want to point out feature no one points that it comes with a fairly long handle that you can hang the camera around your neck/attach it to your arm. Usually small cameras do not come with long cords/handles but this one does. So when you ski it hangs on your neck, when you swim you can wrap it to your hand and still has pleanty of handle to move and maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Gboston

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: After reading several favorable reviews, I ordered the AW100 and it arrived just before Christmas. I am still learning all the features, but very impressed with all the things this little camera does. As others have commented, the battery life is "short" with GPS enabled. So I turned GPS off and purchased a second battery. I haven't tried the View NX2 software, too comfortable with Picasa. One detail not readily apparent on Amazon was that memory card not included. There is a small amount of internal memory, but for trips and video an SD card is essential.
customer_reviews.author: William Judd

customer_reviews.title: I expected more¡
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because wanted to have a Nikon one, normaly I bought a Canon cameras or Sony's and this time give the oportunity to Nikon, I do not really know what happened to Nikon enterprise, but the products do not fill my requirements, sorry Nikon¡ slow to focus and shooter speed, do not capture well in low light, does not feel strong enought to be a shock proof camera.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Alberto Poe

customer_reviews.title: Cool camera
customer_reviews.text: I just received this camera in the mail. I got it to replace a large semi-dslr camera that was too bulky to take out on trips. It looks like a solid camera with some good features. I can't wait to test this out at the beach. It will only go 33ft but from what I have read, you can buy a waterproof bag for it and go do 55ft. Worth a try. The newer model (2013) is suppose to go down 59ft.
customer_reviews.author: Mscdex

customer_reviews.title: Another great camera.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an orange one for my husband a year ago at Costco. He loves it kayaking and when we snorkel. This one was on sale for $159.....$200 less than the orange camera. So I purchased it. The camo color doesn't bother me, but I have placed a large orange sticker on the front to help me locate it. Great camera and we no longer have to pass the other camera back/forth in the ocean when we snorkel.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Used for about six months before it fogged
customer_reviews.text: I used this camera hiking and on the beach for about six months before it got condensation inside. This caused the lens to ALWAYS fog up and the pictures were useless. On the other hand, Nikon replaced it with the AW110 which has not had this issue yet. Pros: - The GPS works well and embeds the coordinates and location info right into the picture - Pictures are pretty good both in and out of the water
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!!
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life. Good picture quailty. Very durable. Had it with me while in Afghanistan.
customer_reviews.author: Raysiel Forty

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a camera that would hold up on a trip to Costa Rica that included zip-lining, fishing and horseback riding, etc. I also purchased filters for it. The video jumps at regular intervals, and if you use filters in a high humidity area, don't put them on in an air conditioned room. They will fog. Otherwise, the camera works well.
customer_reviews.author: Henskier

customer_reviews.title: Not so water proof
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for less then 2 years and so much for the water proof! I used this product a hand full of times and at first I thought that it was going to be great but I was wrong , I called nikon when water got into the camera and nikon referred me to a repair shop , I just got the camera back and they told me it cant be fixed. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: sting

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Takes good pictures both inside and outside. The GPS option is great! It always lets you know right where you're taking a picture, not just the city but the exact business, landmark, or whatever point you're taking the picture at. Haven't tried out the "waterproof-ness" yet but it seems to be sealed really well with the battery and USB card all in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy

customer_reviews.title: Must have this Camera!!! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with my new camera. I travel alot, i needed a camera to take pool, outdoor and indoor photos. This camera was the best purchase ever. I took pictures everywhere on my last trip. Picture Quality is great. It work inside the water which i cary with me all the time. This is a must have Camera for very one that travels. The color looks great as well. I am very Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: liz

product_meta.title: Nikon COOLPIX AW100 16 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera with GPS and Full HD 1080p Video (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackThe Nikon AW100 26290 COOLPIX Digital Camera is the perfect companion for all your rugged and extreme adventures. Shoot every view and heartbeat with its 5x Zoom-NIKKOR ED glass lens and a 16.0-MP CMOS sensor which works best under the lowest of lighting conditions. Dive into 33 feet of water or climb to a chilling altitude of 15 degrees Fahrenheit and still get the most amazing, high-quality, high definition shots any time. With the Action Control feature, it allows you to adjust its settings when wearing gloves, capture high-impact photos and preview it through its 3.0-inch TFT-LCD anti-reflective display. Create action-packed movies and connect it to your laptop, desktop or HDTV to share your most thrilling adventures with friends and family, in stereo sound. Built for adventure, the Nikon AW100 26290 COOLPIX Digital Camera has a GPS tracking software and an electronic compass to guide you through unfamiliar route. Take steady shots and never miss the action with the Nikon AW100 262 What's In The Box: EH-62F AC Adapter EN-EL 12 Rechargeable Battery UC-E6 USB Cable EG-CP16 Audio Video Cable MH-65 Battery Charger UR-E23 Filter Attachment.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



You live to be “in the moment,” so anything that brings back the rush is worth it. The Nikon COOLPIX AW100 is water-proof, shock-proof and freeze-proof, so you can take it on all of your extreme adventures. It packs a 5x Zoom-NIKKOR ED glass lens and a 16.0-MP CMOS sensor to record low-light and fast-action photos and Full HD (1080p) movies. Life on the road deserves GPS + e-Compass, so the AW100's got these too. Add a 3-inch monitor, our new Action Control for easily adjusting settings when wearing gloves plus a range of in-camera special effects, and you've got a camera as rugged as you. Start saving those action-packed memories—every view and heartbeat.


READY FOR EXTREME ADVENTURES
WATER-PROOF, SHOCK-PROOF AND FREEZE-PROOF
The AW100 can handle all that Mother Nature can throw at it. Take it diving to depths of up to 33-feet. Shoot at temperatures as cold as 14° F. And don't sweat drops of up to 5-feet. Whether it's in your hand, mounted to a surfboard, clipped on a backpack or attached to a scuba tank, every twist, splash, dive and crash can be recorded in both still and Full HD (1080p) movie. Plus, Nikon's new Action Control brings fast and easy operation to gloved hands. The AW100 lets you capture every thrilling moment from inside the action—not the sidelines.

SHOOT IN EXTREME LOW LIGHT
16.0-MP CMOS SENSOR
Adventure doesn't always happen during perfect photo-taking conditions. Imagine sharp images produced 33-feet underwater, photos and movies captured while you explore a dark cave or get in one last run as the sun is setting. What does it take to get these and more? A 16.0-MP CMOS sensor that blazes through low light, fast action and challenging shooting conditions to capture high-impact photos with exceptional image quality and low noise. Shoot 3 shots in about one second, plus one-touch control for Full HD (1080p) movies combine to ensure not a single moment of your action-packed lifestyle is missed.

STAR IN YOUR OWN VIRAL MOVIES
FULL HD (1080P) MOVIES WITH STEREO SOUND
Don't just share some photos with friends, put them inside the action with you. Imagine reliving the downhill snowboarding rush, the incredible view as you hang glide down a 4,000-foot peak or showing your friends exactly what you experienced "shooting the tube" in Hawaii. Attach the AW100 to your gear, and with a single touch of the control you're creating an in-the-action Full HD (1080p) movie with stereo sound. You'll capture all of life's adventures from a whole new perspective—your own.



SEE WHERE YOU’RE GOING, MARK WHERE YOU’VE BEEN
BUILT-IN GPS, MAPPING AND E-COMPASS
Imagine you and a friend are white water rafting down an unfamiliar route. The AW100's rugged waterproof build can take the pounding action while you record photos and movies of this incredible adventure, and it's built-in GPS can track your progress with Nikon View NX2 software, Nikon's mypicturetown photo sharing site or Google Earth™. Its built-in maps let you view your path, and its electronic compass is an extra safety measure that can even help you ascertain which branch to take if there's a fork in the stream. Your GPS travelogue will give you bragging rights as you share the adventure with your friends.

CREATIVE CONTROL EVEN IN GLOVES
A HANDY ACTION CONTROL FEATURE
More creativity at your fingertips—even if your fingertips are enclosed in ski gloves! The AW100's handy Action Control feature makes it easy to adjust specific camera settings. Wrapped up in the action with no time to adjust? The AW100 automatically adjusts camera settings. And if you're looking to add creativity, select in-camera effects such as black and white, or selective color. There's even an underwater mode to keep images colorful and properly exposed.



STEADY EVEN WHEN YOU’RE NOT
The AW100's five advanced VR image stabilizing features automatically reduce the streaky images associated with shaky cameras.

SHARPER OBJECTS IN MOTION
To ward off motion blur, the AW100's motion detector automatically tracks moving subjects and adjusts the camera's settings to keep them in focus.
feature_bullets: Water-proof, Shock-proof, Freeze-proof: ruggedly built for reliable and comfortable outdoor operation. Water-proof to a depth of 33 feet.
Shockproof if dropped from 5 ft, operating temperature down to 14 degrees F
16 effective megapixel CMOS sensor ideal for low light shooting and fast operation
Points of Interest (locations, landmarks, etc.) and location information (latitude and longitude) can be added to your photos

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,113 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
